en-us.learning_promise:
This unit will develop your students' engineering design skills as they investigate ways of defining problems, brainstorming solutions, and testing and refining prototypes. They'll refine their problem-solving skills as they create a solution to a problem that has constraints, and improve on others’ ideas. All while honing their ability to identify failure points and success criteria when comparing, modifying, and evaluating a solution.

Your students will improve their communication skills as they engage in a range of collaborative discussions about their solutions.

lessons.lesson_description: Help Leo say "good morning" to his friends!
lessons.lesson_sub_title: Help Leo say "good morning" to his friends!

text.content: Leo is frustrated that he can't say "good morning" to his friends. He's too short and gets lost in the crowd.
Leo thinks there must be a solution. He wants to greet his friends before they go into their classrooms.
Build a waving machine that Leo can use to say "good morning" to his friends.
Here's your challenge: create the program that starts the waving machine.
Create the program. It starts the waving machine.

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)

- LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential Set
- Device with the LEGO® Education SPIKE™ App installed

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Lesson 1 Good Morning Machine

lessons.lesson_description: Daniel’s locker is overflowing. How can he get all his things home?
lessons.lesson_sub_title: Daniel’s locker is overflowing. How can he get all his things home?
lessons.student_worksheet_description: Daniel’s locker is overflowing. How can he get all his things home?

text.content: Daniel’s locker is overflowing. He can't close it because it's so full!
Daniel needs to clean out his locker. He wishes he had help carrying his things home.
Build the robot helper for Daniel. It'll help him carry his things.
Here's your challenge: create the program that controls the robot helper.
Create the program. It controls the robot helper.

Program the robot helper to follow Daniel home.
Design your own improved robot helper.

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Lesson 2 Big Little Helper

lessons.lesson_description: What do you think a high-tech playground would look like? Help Maria design something new for her friends!
lessons.lesson_sub_title: What do you think a high-tech playground would look like? Help Maria design something new for her friends!

text.content: Maria is disappointed. There isn’t anything fun for her and her friends to play on during recess.
Maria wishes they had a cool, high-tech playground.
Build the high-tech seesaw for Maria.
Here's your challenge: create the program that rocks the seesaw.
Create the program. It rocks the seesaw.

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)

- Device with the LEGO® Education SPIKE™ App installed

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Lesson 3 High-Tech Playground

lessons.lesson_description: Help Sofie create a new way for her friends to throw out their trash.
lessons.lesson_sub_title: Help Sofie create a new way for her friends to throw out their trash.

text.content: Sofie has noticed that some of her friends don't throw out their trash after lunch.
Sofie thinks if the trash can was more interesting, her friends might remember to throw out their trash.
Build the trash-eating monster for Sofie. It'll make throwing out trash more fun.
Here's your challenge: create the program that makes the trash-eating monster react to the blue "trash."
Create the program. It makes the trash-eating monster react to the blue "trash."

text.content: Upgrade the program to react to different-colored "trash."
Design your own improved trash-eating monster.

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)

- LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential Set
- Device with the LEGO® Education SPIKE™ App installed

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Lesson 4 Trash Monster Machine

lessons.lesson_description: How can Maria’s soccer game be more like a computer game?
lessons.lesson_sub_title: How can Maria’s soccer game be more like a computer game?

text.content: Maria isn't having fun playing soccer. She prefers the wackiness of her computer games.
Maria thinks it would be awesome if the goal could come to life and move around the field.
Build the moving goal to help make soccer more interesting for Maria.
Here's your challenge: create the program that moves the goal. Don’t let Sofie score!
Create the program. It moves the goal.

text.content: Modify the program to make the goal move in a different way. Can Sofie still score?
Design your own upgraded moving goal.

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)

- LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential Set
- Device with the LEGO® Education SPIKE™ App installed

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Lesson 5 Winning Goal

lessons.lesson_description: How can Daniel’s literary randomizer make picking a book more exciting?
lessons.lesson_sub_title: How can Daniel’s literary randomizer make picking a book more exciting?

text.content: Daniel can't decide which book to read. He feels overwhelmed by all the books in the library.
Daniel wonders if there's something that could help him pick a book genre.
Build the literary randomizer for Daniel. It'll help him pick a book genre.
Here's your challenge: create the program that picks the book genre.
Create the program. It picks the book genre.

text.content: Modify the program to improve how the literary randomizer works.
Design your own upgraded literary randomizer.

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)

- LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential Set
- Device with the LEGO® Education SPIKE™ App installed

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Lesson 6 Literary Randomizer

lessons.lesson_description: It's time to create your very own invention for the team's classroom!
lessons.lesson_sub_title: It's time to create your very own invention for the team's classroom!

text.content: The team thinks there's a way to bring a new creation to their classroom.
They wonder what would be the most helpful.
Imagine ways their new creation could help in their classroom.
Here's your challenge: design a new creation for the team’s classroom. Use at least one motor or sensor.
Here's your challenge: design a new creation for the team’s classroom. Use at least one motor or sensor.

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)

- LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential Set
- Device with the LEGO® Education SPIKE™ App installed
- OPTIONAL: Additional materials for brainstorming (e.g., notebook paper, science notebook, etc.)

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Lesson 7 Your School Creation

en-us.title: Gecko Quirky Creations U5
en-us.unit_plan_description: Time to problem solve! Help Maria, Daniel, Sofie, and Leo solve some of their big school problems. What can you build and program to help them?
